pages.text: The $(thing)Mechanical Generator$() is a basic method of generating $(thing)FE$(). When connected to a mechanical network, the generator will turn and produce electricity.$(br2)To toggle automatic power output to neighboring blocks, press the $(thing)Toggle$() button.
The higher the speed, the faster the $(thing)Mechanical Generator$() produces electricity.$(br2)The Mechanical Generator has a maximum rate of $(thing)1 FE per tick$().

The $(thing)Steam Generator$() is an advanced method of generating $(thing)FE$(). When placed above a heat source, it consumes water and produces electricity.$(br2)Water can either be brought in with buckets using the input slot, or piped in from another source.
The higher the temperature, the faster the $(thing)Steam Generator$() consumes water and produces electricity.$(br2)The Steam Generator has a maximum rate of $(thing)5 FE per tick$().

It is important to make sure you have enough $(thing)FE storage$() to capitalize on the entirety of your fuel's burn time.$(br2)The thermometer in the interface is different than heat producing sources as it shows the temperature up to its highest functioning value.$(br2)To toggle automatic power output to neighboring blocks, press the $(thing)Toggle$() button.
